Patch Set 28:

(1 comment)

This just adds PCieSlots to the PCIe Device collection (I think the validator will fail here because they are in the collection but not actually implemented). I think we need to make backend changes here, as discussed in discord, either: 

1. Sunset https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Inventory/Item/PCIeSlot.interface.yaml and add those properties to the PCIe Device interface 
Or 
2. Add an association from PCie Device to PCIe Slot that bmcweb can walk to fill out the slot info
I started working on implementing option 1, but I found that it would require making significant changes in several repositories. Therefore, I am now exploring option 2.
Updated the commit message.

Would this function is to add an emptySlot if there is no device?
Perhaps name the function like `addEmptyPCIeSlotIfNotUsed()`?
Changed the name to addEmptyPCIeSlot, empt PCIeSlot means not in use.
Since `ec` is not used in this function, we can use `ec` here (instead of `ec1`).
Done
`ec1.value()` preferred?
Done
`ec.value()` preferred?
Done
Comments not related to this commit.
Done
If there are no association endpoints, it means that this is an empty PCIeSlot. We should continue to addEmptyPCIeSlot.
I wonder if we want an email out on the list for this..?
I sent mail https://lore.kernel.org/openbmc/02a15f1e4669516f6912a5e97a5bff32@linux.vnet.ibm.com/

Be careful here, let's not do this again. 
Every commit should stand on its own. Pass the validator on its own.
Ack

Wouldn't it be like?

```
bool found = std::find(pcieDevicePaths.begin(),
                       pcieDevicePaths.end(), 
                       pcieDevicePath) != pcieDevicePaths.end();
```
Done
Does it make more sense to just pass this in ?
It doesn't matter much. Since this function is simple and self-contained, extracting pcieDeviceList inside the function could make it more readable.
Ack
I am confused why you set this twice, here and in addEmptyPCIeSlot ?

In the error path of getEmptyPCIeSlots (ex: line #99), it returns without updating the count. Also, I left the getPCIeDeviceList as is because we will replace the code with a new getCollectionMembers function in the https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/64087.
Ack. I did the refactor of getCollectionMembers before this commit, we don't need this line.
Done

We require a list of PCIeDevices. It's possible to have multiple different objects sharing the same 'contained_by' association path. This association can be used for PCIe Device, Boards or Chassis. In addEmptyPCIeSlot, we iterate through each object and verify if the PCIeSlot contains a PCIe Device.

This is discord discussion
https://discord.com/channels/775381525260664832/855566794994221117/1115344545815744532

My suggested logic is the same as what you described.

The main loop is on pcieSlotPaths in both cases, and then check whether there is any device on the slot.

The difference is how to check the existence of a  pcie device.
getAssociatedSubtreePaths() is for the purpose.


```
for each  pcieSlotPaths
{
   // The logic here is to check whether there is a pcieDevice
}
```

How to check whether it is a pcie device or not is done by getAssociatedSubTreePaths() by setting the specific interface 'PCIeDevice'
so that the only PCIeDevice (not others) is checked.

if we use getAssociatedSubTreePaths, it queries the entire PCIeDevice subtree for each PCIeSlot to check if the endpoint is a PCIeDevice. While this approach may enhance code readability, it could impact performance. I am inclined to prioritize performance. However, I'm open to changing the code to use getAssociatedSubTreePaths if Ed/Gunnar prefers that approach.
Done

What's going on with this patch?  It keeps getting rebased, but isn't marked WIP and per the commit message fails the service validator (which means it can't merge).

What's the intent here?

Next commit is ready for review
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/63136

I will merge both commits together.
